intro: Notylia adunca, commonly known as the rough-leaved notylia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to Mediterranean climates. The plant features wiry, sparsely leafy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Notylia adunca is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics reflect its adaptation to harsh, dry environments.
